body: LEAD: While snowflakes swirled, scattered by harsh winter winds, and three police helicopters flew in tribute yesterday, 5,000 police officers from around the metropolitan region, family members and friends mourned the death of the first New York City police officer killed in the line of duty this year. While snowflakes swirled, scattered by harsh
title: 5,000 Colleagues Pay Tribute To Slain Officer in Brooklyn

body: LEAD: A crowd of Hasidic Jews surrounded and beat a black teen-ager who they believed had just slashed a Hasidic woman and her son during a robbery in the Crown Heights section of Brooklyn Friday night, the police said. A crowd of Hasidic Jews surrounded and beat a black teen-ager who they believed had just slashed a Hasidic woman and her son
title: Crowd in Brooklyn, Angered at Slashing, Beats a 16-Year-Old

body: LEAD: Two men were charged yesterday in the slaying of a plainclothes police officer who, the authorities said, was killed with his own gun in a struggle with the suspects on a Brooklyn street early Friday. title: 2 Men Charged in Slaying Of a Policeman in Flatbush

body: LEAD: In and near Manhattan, National Women's History Month is being celebrated with special activities. Many are listed in the free Women's History Month calendar published by the New York City Commission on the Status of Women, 52 Chambers Street, Suite 207, New York, N.Y. 10007; 566-3833. Here is a selection of events: In and near Manhattan,
title: Women's History Month

body: LEAD: The Brooklyn Museum will begin its Eighth Annual Thomas A. Edison-Black Maria Film and Video Festival Sunday at 2 P.M. The videos run from the purely artistic to documentaries on social injustice. The program is free, with a suggested museum contribution: $3; students $1.50, and the elderly, $1. The museum is at 200 Eastern Parkway, at
title: Video Festival

body: LEAD: A police officer critically wounded a man in a Brooklyn apartment building last night during a gun battle in which the officer was shot in the chest but escaped serious injury because he was wearing a bulletproof vest, the police said. A police officer critically wounded a man in a Brooklyn apartment building last night during a gun battle in
title: Vest Saves Officer Who Badly Wounds Brooklyn Gunman

body: LEAD: February is Black History Month. A selection of events follows. Today LEHMAN COLLEGE, Bedford Park Boulevard West and Goulden Avenue, in the Bedford Park section of the Bronx. A talk by Donald Polk, the president of the New York Urban League, at 11 A.M., and a performance by Joan Miller's Dance Players at noon (960-8283). February is Black
title: Events of Black History Month

body: LEAD: One year after they lost their apartment and ended up in a single room at the Brooklyn Arms, Linda Adeyeye and her five daughters are starting over. title: Helping the Ex-Homeless Furnish a Home

body: LEAD: A ten-year Fire Department veteran searching a blazing Brooklyn apartment building yesterday became the first New York City firefighter killed in more than a year, the Fire Department said. A ten-year Fire Department veteran searching a blazing Brooklyn apartment building yesterday became the first New York City firefighter killed in more
title: Firefighter Dies As He Searches For Fire Victims

body: LEAD: A police officer was indicted yesterday in the off-duty slaying of a 59-year-old Brooklyn man in a traffic dispute. A police officer was indicted yesterday in the off-duty slaying of a 59-year-old Brooklyn man in a traffic dispute. The officer, Radames Ortiz, 24 years old, faces two counts of second-degree murder, one count of first-degree
title: Officer Indicted In Man's Death In Traffic Fight

body: LEAD: February is Black History Month. Here is a sampling of related events. Today FLUSHING COUNCIL ON CULTURE AND THE ARTS, Flushing Gallery, 136-73 41st Avenue (718-463-7700). Exhibition of the work of James Van Der Zee, who opened his first studio in Harlem in 1914 and went on to photograph many famous black personalities, including Marcus
title: Listing of Black History Month Events

body: LEAD: Federal prosecutors have begun a new inquiry into the financial dealings of two New York State legislators, Assembly Speaker Mel Miller and Senator Martin Markowitz, with the convicted head of a credit union, the United States Attorney in Brooklyn said yesterday. title: Miller's Campaign Files Subpoenaed

body: LEAD: A group of elected officials and clergy in Brooklyn has called for a special prosecutor in the fatal shooting of a black man by a white off-duty police officer in a dispute over a double-parked car. title: Special Prosecutor Is Sought In Shooting by Police Officer

body: LEAD: A New York City police officer was suspended without pay yesterday after he shot and killed a 62-year-old Brooklyn man Monday evening during a traffic dispute while he was off duty. A New York City police officer was suspended without pay yesterday after he shot and killed a 62-year-old Brooklyn man Monday evening during a traffic dispute
title: Officer Is Suspended From Force In Off-Duty Killing of a Motorist

body: LEAD: FOR centuries, gardeners have taken pleasure in creating patterned landscapes. Among the earliest, believed to have come from pagan rituals and Greek mythology, are mazes or labyrinths: networks of paths through which it is difficult to find a way. title: A Garden Tied In Knots

body: LEAD: Medgar Evers College, a two-year community college in central Brooklyn with a long history of administrative problems, should be turned into a four-year institution to give it greater stability and status, an independent consulting firm has recommended. title: 4-Year Status Urged For Medgar Evers To Stabilize College

body: LEAD: Many schools, libraries and churches have scheduled events to honor the 60th anniversary of the birth of the Rev. title: King Musical Celebrations: Where and When

body: LEAD: A Brooklyn man was charged with homicide yesterday in the death of a 14-year-old student, Jeffrey Vilain, who was caught in the middle of a gun battle between a police officer and a suspected robber in the East Flatbush section. title: Man Charged in Death Of a 14-Year-Old Boy

body: LEAD: A 14-year-old boy returning home from church services in Brooklyn was shot in the head and killed Tuesday night after he and his family were caught in crossfire between a policeman and a robbery suspect. title: 14-Year-Old Bystander Is Killed In a Police Shootout in Brooklyn

body: LEAD: A 17-year-old Brooklyn youth, who the police later learned was a suspect in a fatal hit-and-run accident in June, was shot early yesterday morning by a police officer during a routine stop for a minor traffic violation, a police spokesman said. title: Youth Shot by Police Is a Hit-Run Suspect
